segments.text: I'm just observing this kitchen, and I find it quite perplexing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is truly overflowing, water streaming onto the floor without end.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's such a striking detail that the woman doesn't notice it at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's standing right in the puddle, diligently drying her plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus is so complete, it's almost infuriating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can anyone be so completely oblivious to their immediate surroundings?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children, meanwhile, are taking full advantage of the distraction.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is practically defying gravity on that unstable stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's going to fall and potentially hurt himself badly; it makes me quite worried.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And the little girl is an eager accomplice, waiting for her forbidden treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This entire scene is a perfect storm of overlooked hazards and mischievous planning.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast with the calm garden outside is almost mocking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to shout at her to look down and see the mess!
segments.speaker: PAR
